title: Chris Pratt Is Trolling Katherine Schwarzenegger for 'Trying to Cook' — & Burning! — Bagel Bites
text:
Click here to read the full article.

Like the newlyweds they are, Chris Pratt is trolling Katherine Schwarzenegger for burning dinner — and it’s especially funny when you consider what she was trying to make. The Jurassic World star shared a photo of the meal scorched by his bride-of-four-months, revealing the charred remains of a popular (and easy) snack food: Bagel Bites. Schwarzenegger has many talents, but cooking doesn’t appear to be one of them.

Pratt took to Instagram to playfully prod his wife about the dinner mishap. “Proud of my darling for trying to cook tonight. Did it go well? No. No, it did not. Not at all. To quote Rocky Balboa, ‘It’s not how many times you get knocked down, it’s how many times you get up… and keep moving forward.’ As you can tell from the lump of coal in the center of the plate, this bagel bite never stood a chance,” he said.

More from SheKnows

He continued, “I honestly simply cannot imagine what went wrong here. Pretty simple. Microwave. 2 minutes. Maybe she thought it said 2 hours. But I want to commend her for her effort. This is a big step babe. Proud of you.” Hilariously, Schwarzenegger’s little brother Patrick Schwarzenegger commented on the post, writing only, “Smh @katherineschwarzenegger.”

Her cooking skills (or lack thereof) aren’t the only thing earning Schwarzenegger some light-hearted needling lately. Earlier this month, the pair’s pal Rob Lowe poked fun at her golf game. When asked about spending a day playing the sport with both Pratt and Schwarzenegger, Lowe said, “I’m always third-wheeling. I’m a professional third wheeler. It’s just my lot in life. But no, I don’t think Katherine’s golf game is up to snuff, so we don’t need to worry about that. It’s still a guy’s escape.”

Schwarzenegger didn’t debate her lack of golfing prowess. During an appearance on Today With Hoda & Jenna after the third-wheel outing, she admitted, “I don’t golf well.” So, something tells us she doesn’t harbor any illusions about her cooking either. But hey, as Pratt pointed out, just firing up that microwave is forward progress.
